title: Cake that uses SALAD and mayonnaise for its filling is slammed online
text:
A sponge cake which boasts layers of raw salad and mayonnaise filling has been mercilessly mocked online after creators suggested it was a 'guilt-free' 'healthy' option.

Footage of the dish being made was shared on Facebook group Well, That’s Certainly A Cake Wreck, with the video originally being posted by C CHANNEL - a Japanese online lifestyle magazine for women.

The cake featured a layer of raw carrot, avocado, and purple cabbage, with mayonnaise and black pepper spread underneath each ingredient, as well as a topping of cream cheese and tofu, before being garnished with more salad.

Social media users were quick to criticise the cake and its bizarre ingredients, claiming it seemed no healthier than several of it sweet counterparts.

A sponge cake (pictured) which boasts layers of raw salad and mayonnaise filling has been mercilessly mocked online after creators suggested it was a 'guilt-free' 'healthy' option

The cake (pictured) featured a layer of raw carrot, avocado, and purple cabbage, with mayonnaise and black pepper spread underneath each ingredient

Social media users (pictured) were quick to criticise the cake and its bizarre ingredients

One person wrote: 'That's disgusting! And sorry but there is absolutely nothing healthy about that cake except from the plain vegetables [on top].'

Another questioned: 'Since when is mayo and cream cheese guilt free?'

A third wrote: 'Cake is still cake! Most of the calories when you eat cake are from the cake itself because of its carbohydrates. What is the point of this?! Just eat a normal damn cake lol'

'Just because you can make something doesn't mean you should,' another unimpressed social media user wrote.

Several people claimed the cake seemed no healthier than several of it sweet counterparts

Others hit back at the post for implying that people should feel guilty if they eat cake and opt for a 'healthy' one instead.

'Guilt free? F*** you, I’m going to eat three servings of flan with a smile, C Channel. How dare you present this crime against cake!', one person raged.

Another said: 'This is a) horrifying b) stop saying foods are guilt free as if we are guilty for eating and c) how is it even healthier than cake when it’s covered in cream cheese and mayo?'

The C CHANNEL's original post was shared more than 1,500 times and liked by nearly 600 people.
description: The cake, made by a Japanese online lifestyle magazine featured a layer of raw carrot, avocado, and purple cabbage, with mayonnaise and black pepper spread underneath each ingredient.
